newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thailand pleas for help among financial sector.
newsitem.headline: Thailand pleas for help among financial sector.

text.p: The Bank of Thailand has asked domestic financial institutions to support each other by avoiding calling back existing loans and lending new funds to finance firms which have liquidity problem, a senior finance executive said.

"The central bank today requested co-operation among financial institutions to help each other during this situation," Pakhawat Kovithvathanaphong, the president of Securities One, told reporters after a meeting with central bank officials.
The BOT late on Monday held an urgent meeting with local financial institutions to clarify and explain the bank's recent measures to help liquidity-strapped financial firms, he said.

Many financial firms are now facing liquidity crunch caused by a combination of problems such as bad loans from depressed property sector and the Bank of Thailand's decision to keep interest rates high to counter baht attack.
The situation was exacerbated by reluctance of commercial banks to lend to finance sector due to concerns over its future.
The Bank of Thailand on Monday told 10 finance firms to increase their capital immediately as they do not have sufficient provisions for doubtful loans and sub-standard assets.
